Partly cloudy PERIOD Low 56F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm















Heading to Santa Barbara Community College with an undefeated record the Orange Coast College mens volleyball team hung on to continue its 15game winning streak in a fiveset thriller Saturday PERIOD

A nonconference rematch of the Southern California Regional playoffs showcased the Santa Barbara Vaqueros playing with a newfound vengeance and intensity after a fourset defeat by Coast sent OCC to the State Final Four PERIOD After Coast jumped out to a controlling twoset lead SBCC battled back forcing the Pirates to a decisive fifth set which OCC won handily  PERIOD

Head coach Travis Turner voiced his concerns heading into the match citing how much of a bad matchup the two teams were and praising Santa Barbaras team as a whole PERIOD

Before Saturdays challenging match OCCs top ranked volleyball team extended its winning streak to  as it cruised past rival Golden West College inside the Basil H PERIOD Peterson Gym Friday night PERIOD

Having dominated the Rustlers in two matches last season the Pirates continued its success winning the match in three straight sets PERIOD

Obviously we are playing really well right now Turner said PERIOD Weve been really focused and worried about the next match PERIOD No one inside the group is really talking about how were undefeated. fridays match was dominated for the Pirates by freshman middle blocker Will Anderson who had a match best nine kills but also contributed on the defensive end with multiple solo blocks PERIOD

Opening the first set the Pirates took advantage of the Rustlers overpowering its kills and went out to an early sevenpoint lead PERIOD Coast showed poise and was able to control the entire first set and Anderson sealed the set with a thunderous kill and immediately following the kill with a service ace to give the Pirates a  victory  in a dominating  minutes of play PERIOD

We played well PERIOD It was a good chance to get some other guys some playing time Turner said PERIOD I thought that they did a great job. the match against the Rustlers brought some of the best outside hitters in the state with Coasts own sophomore Kyle McCauley and GWCs Matt Coleman PERIOD McCauley is averaging . kills per set ranking fourth in the state PERIOD

Turner attributes the key to the early season success from strong leadership guiding what he calls a healthy mix of both new and returning players PERIOD That mix of players are eight freshmen and nine sophomores PERIOD

Anchoring the Pirate offense were setters sophomore Enzo Boggio and freshman Jordan Rodriguez who combined for  assists PERIOD Boggio also notched a team best seven digs PERIOD

Golden West attempted to keep the match close but the strong hitting of Coast proved to be too much by the third and final set OCC quickly got out to a  lead PERIOD The Pirates benefited from success while serving when freshman opposite hitter Matthew Gemeinhardt had two consecutive service aces find the corner of the court PERIOD

OCC dominated the third and final set allowing the Rustlers only three kills in the entire set PERIOD Pirate outside hitter Clark Steele had three kills in the third set alone PERIOD

Getting past the OCC middle blockers has proven to be challenging with Jake Loudenback leading the Orange Empire Conference with . blocks per set which is second best in the state PERIOD

After falling to LA Pierce College in the California Community College Athletic Association state championship last season the Pirates are poised to make yet another championship run starting conference play strong by dominating state and conference powers Irvine Valley College and GWC in its first two OEC matches PERIOD

We have to keep doing what were doing and not make a lot of adjustments Turner said. as long as were attentive and our effort is good I think were in good shape. turner is primed and ready to take his program to its third straight State Championship appearance but dont be surprised to see the team stop there PERIOD He credits work in the offseason is the key to what gets his teams in the best shape to make a deep run when the playoffs begin PERIOD

You win or lose that match in April in the fall Turner said PERIOD Its all about how hard you work to make sure losing doesnt happen again. with six conference matches left before the playoffs Coast will return to conference play on the road tonight against Santiago Canyon College and will return home on March  as they take on Fullerton College at  p.m PERIOD
